attributes.action: Withdraw Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts (PCSC) Bill 2021.
attributes.additional_details:
Within PCSC allows the Home Sectary to decide without scrutiny to ban any protest falling within the definition of 'serious disruption'. Potentially banning all anti-government protests outside Parliament or the Courts.

If protestors distract one employee or disturb one by-passer the police can restrict and ban protests. 

Guardian:https://www.theguardian.com/law/2021/mar/11/civil-liberties-groups-call-police-plans-for-demos-an-assault-on-right-to-protest
attributes.background: Withdraw PCSC or all sections relating to protesting, due to suppressing and attacking the democratic rights of the British people.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Do not pass the Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579242

Do not restrict our rights to peaceful protest: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579012

Remove single person protest clauses in Police, Crime, Sentencing & Courts Bill: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/578875
